briefdescription.para: Entity that factory fn is being called for.
Let this controlled know it has been disowned.

detaileddescription.para: This method clears the entity pointer when we have been disowned.

briefdescription.para: Return our type, for serialisation only.
Return whether or not we are attached to an entity.
Return the entity that owns us.
Return the user data for this controller.
Write our state to a buffer. (Don't stop running yet.)
Read our state from a buffer. (Don't start running yet.)

detaileddescription.para: This virtual method is called when this controller is started on a real entity. It can be overridden by derived controllers to perform tasks when the controller is started initially or when the controller has been offloaded with an offloaded entity.
The controller must be in DOMAIN_REAL for this to be called.

parameterdescription.para: True if this is the first time this controller has been started, false if from an offload (or a restore).

detaileddescription.para: This virtual method is called when this controller is started on a real entity. It can be overridden by derived controllers to perform tasks when the controller is stopped for the last time or when the controller is being offloaded with an offloaded entity.
The controller must be in DOMAIN_REAL for this to be called.
Nothing must be done in these methods which could cause a controller to be created.

parameterdescription.para: True if this is the final time this controller will be stopped, false if caused by an offload.

briefdescription.para: Cancel this controller. This can be done by other Controllers.
Ghost the ghost part of this controller to all the haunts of its entity.

detaileddescription.para: This method updates the ghost of this controller on all ghosts of the entity. It can only be called on controllers on real entities.

briefdescription.para: Send a standard callback to the script object.

detaileddescription.para: This method calls a named callback on the script object with two arguments: the id of the controller, and the user data.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the method to call

briefdescription.para: Create a controller given a type.

detaileddescription.para: This static method creates a new controller given a type.
This static method returns a python object representing the factory method for the given named controller, if such a controller exists.
This static method adds the controller factory method names to the given tuple, and returns the number it added.
This static method add controller type name into MD5 digest.
This static method returns a singleton container with entries about all registered controller types indexed by controller type ID.
A controller is a server object that is owned by a real entity. It must move between cells when the entity moves, and must be able to serialise its state for this reason.
